72ABDD5E856740FC84C5DC453228A6FB.description: Critically examine and assess individual work and contributions to collaborative work.

C3252E04C46B41E1A58CED546EF5E58B.description: Demonstrate leadership and support peers during collaborative processes.

54739BC047BE4D51BF14A4D6B4A1034D.description: Investigate connections that exist among the arts, and incorporate more than one art form into own work or collaborative project.

D921BA70FE804782A433E9E6000B9778.description: Examine a variety of new and non-traditional art forms that integrate disciplines.

B0D4CB90DED64BAE8E7131A675080EC1.description: Examine the impact of technology on interdisciplinary art works (e.g., audio visual installations, performance art).

AAF866705D6B405BB262B09AA053375A.description: Identify ways that various arts expressions combine more than one arts discipline.

7C0DDCFF9CD24F20BCDB968B98CFDC20.description: Create interdisciplinary arts expressions individually or through collaboration with peers, and examine the work of artists who create interdisciplinary expressions (e.g., sound and poetry, performance art, audio visual installations).

D0CFDF3D45BB40FAAC78942686F0BEC2.description: Research various career avenues in the arts.

990AE7A28C384E0D93ECA8B2C6035668.description: Describe how environmental, historical, and social factors influence artists.

307D1973F9114275BBD2D01F00C3ED81.description: Investigate how function and purpose influence artistic decision making.

5622C5F9246545F99831ECE5E7EDA749.description: Extend knowledge of artistic styles across a range of cultural contexts.

13477C31A0AE417F9E6A80B993AF2D2B.description: Research and describe the work of contemporary Saskatchewan and Canadian artists.

EB578E556CDD4D548DC263BA84759093.description: Demonstrate an awareness of key historical developments in relation to contemporary arts expressions (i.e., the term contemporary typically includes arts expressions of the late 20th and 21st centuries).

65B9E3D2D2B44F04A3B605BB857528AF.description: Investigate diversity of artistic ideas, styles, and media in contemporary arts expressions.

6CDFB7F7104F49D7A32263FD1C2A26FC.description: Share arts expressions with younger and older students and community, where possible.

E311418742364BA2B547D58F8389FCDD.description: Create a plan of action to use the arts to increase understanding on this topic fo concern (e.g., develop a collective creation/play about racism to increase knowledge and mutual understanding).

D54AEC15F8D44BCDAF84D9A116A395AA.description: Use inquiry to investigate topics of concern to Indigenous peoples: Generate key questions to guide inquiry (e.g., What are topics of concern to Indigenous artists?).,  Create a plan to document the inquiry process. • Research topics addressed by artists (e.g., examine messages and lyrics of a variety of artists such as Buffy Ste. Marie, Floyd Crow Westerman, Eekwol, Reddnation, and Rezofficial), Analyze topics presented by artists in relation to own understanding, value, and experiences. • Summarize research findings to identify central themes (e.g., colonization) and topics (e.g., residential schools),  Identify gaps in knowledge that may limit understanding. • Use the Internet and other sources (e.g., print, digital, community) to gather additional information. • Determine central focus and questions to explore independently and collaboratively (e.g., How could we use the arts to help people understand that we are all Treaty people?). • Reflect, analyze, and make connections between the original topic or inquiry question and subsequent arts expressions.

BECC510C788342D290D67535FB5721E4.description: Use the arts to raise awareness on topics of concern to Indigenous artists in dance, drama, music, and visual arts.

D1A42B21A827477FA848CAE5A149A5CF.description: Investigate arts expressions that raise awareness or inspire community action.

347A715F0A40471180EF6D286C5712BC.description: Recognize and discuss the value of original thought as well as technical proficiency in arts expressions.

646CEE3FDC124A6A8AF5CEA9FCB80B8E.description: Examine how artists used popular culture to express unique ideas and to comment on society.

46FF16E53F124EA8ACA7F1B68685F435.description: Research and describe how artists often raise awareness about local or global issues.

09462D4A4D5440219127D725EC3E3553.description: Investigate and discuss the role of artists in raising awareness or taking action on topics of concern.

A95A31CCF4BD4B9BB93B70811A533E2F.description: Cultural/Historical (CH) - Children will investigate the content and aesthetics of the arts within cultural, historical, and contemporary contexts and understand the connection between the arts and human experience.

6B5587B6D27F464B924B24E4563ADDCC.description: Investigate and explain why some arts expressions were considered to be controversial at different times in history.

E2220A3B01BE469F85CB706F2B7ECDE5.description: Demonstrate interest in the ideas and work of today’s artists, and appreciate original thought.

E40B9ACE3D5745768BA7E0BF3CC082F5.description: Describe how art works are expressions of individual and collective viewpoints.

8C49E05B4D754C10BC3B68CADF078DED.description: Collaborate with peers on development of criteria for assessing the expression of ideas in own arts expressions.

6602426F25024DB68698EE4259B26135.description: Examine societal issues and their influence on current arts expressions (e.g., arts as social or political commentary).

9E1DA2D45F45492781A066427F275480.description: Examine the intentions, development, and interpretations of own arts expressions in relation to own experience, values, and perspectives

9A1AC9A1BD03410EAAD117598B11536C.description: Describe how the arts can transmit or question values, ideas, and beliefs.

5107B95E65C24A34A397D903D30DC012.description: Investigate and identify how arts expressions can challenge thinking about values, ideas, and beliefs.

6874DA7E5D1F4092B6FBB12D47FA1A47.description: Describe how arts expressions can initiate or support social change (e.g., raising awareness about environmental issues, raising money for African famine relief, commenting on social injustice or other controversial topics).

CF13B6A819374C3C90605E4F36514910.description: Examine a variety of new and non-traditional art forms.

BDE72DDC4D4244A7A9C5F0C26A203BAD.description: Investigate and describe ways in which various arts movements (e.g., impressionism, cubism, 1950s rock and roll, 1920s dance crazes, guerilla street theatre, site specific performances) often broke the rules of the establishment and reflected change during that time.

92EDC2FDE8894EBF9BE7B4CF34C84D28.description: Examine and describe how new technology has changed the arts and arts careers.

C06C52CF467C4FBF9B1519F6A2DC9432.description: Investigate how arts expressions can inspire change in different ways.

91C9D3175BC1464984E9CD22A5F9CFAD.description: Investigate and identify ways that today’s arts expressions can inspire change.

9758EBD0B1234654924EF01FD80A5A89.description: Create own work in response to a selected professional arts expression, and describe how the new work is inspired or influenced by the original.

8E1BBF2AAB374110B1AA0DFD3A1F0365.description: Create an individual or collaborative plan to investigate the inquiry questions, document the inquiry process, and share findings with others.

E90804ACA94E4B8AAD2D62F6ECB9AB2F.description: Use individual or collaborative inquiry to develop questions and learn about a selected arts expression

C98DC63785084F64A9468FC2304C2609.description: Respond to professional dance, drama, music, and visual art works through individual or collaborative inquiry and the creation of own arts expressions.

A722D9DF0EC74FCC819A6091A882D2F8.description: Critical/Responsive (CR) - Children will respond to artistic expressions of Saskatchewan, Canadian, and International artists using critical thinking, research, creativity, and collaborative inquiry

9F9ABD31F8C741A7B723EDB8EE47A207.description: Describe own decision-making and problem-solving processes, and reflect on the effectiveness of choices made.

0BC60CA37EF64E02AA85C515473F4520.description: Solve visual art challenges or problems in innovative ways (e.g., imaginative use of point of view, perspective, colour theory, proportion, exaggeration, or distortion).

DDD12F3E957445EE894A430E0AF4695A.description: Experiment with new ways of using symbols and manipulation of images.

CF05E7B0499045828A2A8CCA4D871906.description: Take risks by working in unfamiliar ways (e.g., new ideas, techniques, or media).

5E256F0A9D5F463FBA2BDE013DCC136F.description: Solve visual art problems in new and unfamiliar ways.

0BDC7A79A2CA41DC87820D05FFCC13C0.description: Demonstrate awareness of various health and safety hazards and procedures in visual art.

851742A56475429AA7CB6B6E881B1F33.description: Demonstrate skills of observation and increased ability to include detailed information in own depictions.

5DE008C703714A3A8BF4D4026E1B1CC2.description: Analyze application of the elements of art, principles of design, images, and techniques in own and peers’ art works.

FC9E075C799F460891FBB28A033F37F2.description: Use digital photography or other means to document inquiry and the creative process.

DA0D50F188E74150A6CE308B527DB2BA.description: Create portfolios (e.g., traditional and/or digital) of works in progress and completed work.

421310579B224D4490806065419D727D.description: Demonstrate effective use of visual art tools, materials, and techniques.

070CE432C9824957ADA6A6041C68143F.description: Select visual art forms (e.g., mixed media installation, sculpture) to express ideas about a topic of concern to youth.

1E4CCDAA990E4741B36D9D94AD8A8F22.description: Select and use appropriate forms, technologies, images, and art-making processes to convey ideas about a topic of concern to youth.

C1F90609C3FE41AFB872A76BB2031075.description: Expand upon an idea to achieve more depth of meaning and expression.

152E89D4C4B04388B8CE735857F1D83B.description: Generate ideas for art works through internal and external sources, developing these ideas to achieve meaning and expression.

A3571455FA0847E5B4B1412F42E4CE43.description: Collaborate on a youth-driven and teacher/communitysupported plan to raise awareness through visual art about a topic of concern to youth: Propose ways of including community members and artists who share the same concerns, and develop an action plan to share parts or entire visual art expressions with others.

CD3EB06F881C40BEB77CE6FC018F26DD.description: Design, with other students, a plan to guide the visual art inquiry and document the creative process

427D91FB4D2F4101A3D5EA662ECA353A.description: Propose topics for inquiry into issues of importance to students (e.g., select a topic of current concern to students and/or community).

8BE4D4A629884E46A5D515C753A9A01D.description: Create visual art works to express perspectives and raise awareness about a topic of concern to youth.

F5F1507722D946BEAA91AF2D500D2F7A.description: Compose music using digital technologies where possible (e.g., electronic keyboards, online composing, mixing, and editing tools).

47E842848B97472685F44937B1AC0A89.description: Incorporate technology in innovative ways for creating and/ or documenting the creative process.

5935F1FE81724BABA6289E9BFB029F06.description: Investigate uses of new technologies in music (e.g., new electronic music).

426E2CB3C15A467FA786D1610CC7BD7B.description: Use the Internet and other sources to research music styles associated with youth subcultures throughout different periods in history (e.g., rock, jazz, fusion, hip hop, punk, rave cultures).

234AD2D570894AD4A403E2CE39489BA7.description: Generate musical ideas from both internal and external sources, developing these ideas to achieve meaning and expression.

E77835A1D253476A8A234618BAF21698.description: Collaborate on the creation of sound compositions (e.g., songs, bands, drum circles, techno, hip hop, scratching, new musical forms) as part of a youth-driven and teacher/ community-supported plan to raise awareness through music about a topic of concern to youth: • Propose ways of including community members and musicians who share the same concerns, and develop a collaborative action plan to share music expressions with others.

B4BB2F4AFA244ABCB9C9CA7CC68B6312.description: Contribute to the creation of a plan to document the research and composing process (e.g., audio recordings, video, blog, wiki, or web-based audio journal).

4027E7625C1240CD98326F05E3E04E3B.description: Brainstorm and negotiate with other students to determine a process for music inquiry and composing processes.

7ED889A31FC8444CB1D2BB26A61F1E40.description: Examine how musicians and composers express ideas about the world around them and comment on society in their work.

55693098F4D44F9E8CFFBAFE73F5395D.description: Compose and perform sound compositions to express perspectives and raise awareness about a topic of concern to youth.

98F5D4C5A78D48C1912A66F1D382E63C.description: Analyze how elements of music and principles of composition are used in combination to create unified compositions and apply this understanding in own work.

F450AF2E456E4C26880CAAEB2CD19AFE.description: Demonstrate understanding of how music elements and composition principles create form and structure in music

7E5781262FDE430E86358C696AA2ED81.description: Investigate ways that tempo, rhythm, melody, harmonic structure, or tonality can be used to express an idea or emotional quality in music.

FE8B647E68B44EEB97A71AB627736FEB.description: Investigate ways that beat, accent, and metre can be used to create a specific ‘feel’ in music.

28AC2938673745F982D6F9DAE8A6276F.description: Pose questions to initiate and guide inquiry into how best to combine elements of music and principles of composition to express musical ideas (e.g., How could we combine the rhythms that we’ve learned to create a Latin feel in this piece?).

C8A3FE69B1B7418AADB58B48A2D440BF.description: Combine the elements of music and principles of composition to express unified musical ideas.

A5D2D6DB70B84A0A9298B245BF0192B9.description: Use technology to explore and record improvisation.

FCEB9EAC400A458390C89F6E9D0716CC.description: Prepare, rehearse, and present structured compositions and improvisations

521CF670E9234B11BFCC9733CA1E1004.description: Demonstrate capability with electronic and technological mediums of musical expression (e.g., computer-generated sound/music).

65BF700C7D5A4C1A914BD654A6C432ED.description: Examine improvisation within a diverse range of instrumental music from around the world.

2E52A502CF2F4A5398D3AE51BE1A1F18.description: Examine the use of the voice in improvisation in a diverse range of cultural and social contexts.

D964AE16913F4B20A6CD2183BBA146B3.description: Extend singing skills, and understand and be sensitive to the ways voices change with age and musical experiences.

619FB82BEE1349899F6C3BE44E467B60.description: Experiment with the voice and instruments by creating and imitating sounds.

2ECD8189725143CFA842FBA9E976CFF3.description: Create and improvise with an instrument of choice.

97C55E49F77E4B80B939DC96EEF05DA6.description: Demonstrate innovative use of vocal improvisation in song and speech.

A599A6B673944940BFE703319C11357C.description: Use voice, instruments, and technologies to express musical ideas.

C85B87B9C8FF40BC89A9C23775C8865E.description: Analyze and describe the effectiveness of own drama to express perspectives.

27BA6E7D163644B98BB97266B5F162E6.description: Use technology as a tool during the creative process and as part of a presentation, where appropriate.

1D33BF6DAAC049D79371431FD688122F.description: Create and incorporate imagery, sound, and visual effects in collective creation.

2652551D540545BCB85062D7332EFD3D.description: Research different theatrical genres and cultural traditions, and investigate and explore how some of these conventions may be incorporated into the collective creation (e.g., Indonesian shadow puppet theatre, Greek tragedy, vaudeville, improvisational theatre).

86036C75A5D14237888065EC22151DAA.description: Collaborate on exploration and development of the collective creation through developing various roles and characters and incorporating a range of drama strategies.

86AC934BABA04CAA86429C0DE922F7D6.description: Investigate how fictional situations and dramatic episodes related to the chosen topic might be explored (e.g., using structured improv, drawing on different theatrical genres or cultural drama traditions).

34BEF50DD6DD4A9FAF2F272A2A936755.description: Collaborate on a youth-driven and teacher/communitysupported plan to raise awareness through drama about a topic of concern to youth: Propose ways of including community members and theatre artists who share the same concerns, and develop a collaborative action plan to share some parts or entire dramatic expressions with others. and Create and maintain reflective records to document the work (e.g., journal, photos, blog, video).

B30D60B5C3274358B40E7D29F55A3FA3.description: Brainstorm and negotiate with other students to determine a topic of mutual concern to address through a collective creation.

F9E8EBCF258E4956965ECD33B3936BB6.description: Express perspectives and raise awareness about a topic of concern to youth in a collective creation.

97A6A119B135425D93C3DF117B8870D0.description: Propose when to use different strategies to communicate ideas effectively.

18984669E95F4236A7F592D028305F4A.description: Manipulate tension, focus, contrast, and symbol to help achieve intention

CF2828D93A034DCA88C5C9545FAFE7DA.description: Propose ideas for use of symbols in drama work.

E97E5BCB7C2645D1BFAE597BFE4CAD83.description: Recognize and refine how roles and characters function in drama work.

D03FCAD64BCD4B32A1EC0D696FB820A3.description: Negotiate skillfully and work toward consensus in dramatic work.

2299FA08191E4825893CF795DA250AC7.description: Examine how contrast functions within the drama work

F575BB5BF26647999973E9C4326F47D0.description: Reflect on sources and function of tension in the drama work.

DC15235049A94EDDB199A36732987870.description: Demonstrate awareness of how focus is maintained and shifts as the drama unfolds

25F1FC35ED924E6682B7D4740167F2A9.description: Propose how best to incorporate various drama strategies to achieve intentions.

E732B6062EFC424881822E246012DB51.description: Manipulate drama strategies and theatrical elements (e.g., story, character, design, space) to achieve dramatic purpose.

902C4780C40E43F7B8893EEBA884E067.description: Use technology to enhance or clarify dramatic intentions (e.g., videotape improvisations, create lighting and sound effects).

4B4F19A5AFE340DFBE3C5604E768D4FB.description: Use language and drama strategies to achieve dramatic purpose and communicate meaning to an audience

E7FDF087E51D4C65AF15944992F051EB.description: Recognize how research contributes to the authenticity and significance of role and character work.

91802CE6D51B4A6CB1D35EFB3D9A2074.description: Collaborate with other students to explore inquiry questions to develop roles and characters (What if your character came to school in the morning and heard that ...?).

B241914E7C10448E832515879593B0FC.description: Demonstrate focus and concentration in role

6898360665AB4DF39F558392F029AA6C.description: Investigate ways that dramatic characters communicate meaning to others.

7B44DA130E0E4E998F35F2C7F4DB9532.description: Demonstrate how roles may be developed (e.g., through interaction with others, through improvisation and research).

F55F7B0F94804058A4E7E487647B8998.description: Analyze how the various roles assumed interact with others and help to further the drama work.

D573D3F233B9430F99E2038B1E5219D8.description: Assume and develop different kinds of roles in drama work

25C20A15B1834587A9315C80D2A7F99A.description: Demonstrate how roles may be developed and how dramatic characters communicate meaning to an audience.

A133190639D44512AE9EADCE3CEC8599.description: Reflect on composition process and describe ideas, strengths, and areas for potential improvement.

EDD974D55FFE4EB897C4B9398955C5E2.description: Support duo or small group in repeating movement phrases and sequences with accuracy and expression during development, rehearsal, and sharing of work.

3CF07DB931FF4129964082F750DD90FD.description: Record dance phrases (e.g., notation and/or video) to further explore and reconstruct movements.

8D7802771B3D4BF0AB69290ACD66D2E7.description: Encourage other dancers to demonstrate efficient movement related to centre of gravity and body alignment in dance.

33A02B7D9A5E4E3587C922AFF3BCC477.description: Demonstrate self-awareness in decision making about movement choices.

F5554D7101914BDCB3595A2EE942E08D.description: Collaborate with others to explore and refine dance phrases and organize into appropriate form (e.g., ABA, collage, chance, organic) to achieve meaning and expression.

A2B6F0AAB1914803AA4844A8B87E5C6B.description: Demonstrate leadership as a choreographer by offering ideas and guidance to dancers during development of composition.

774D99C249214D2FAA00EEE9FD55919B.description: Generate ideas for movement exploration and development by collaborating in duo and small group work.

534FE279A737415BBB6F7547DF0F6E45.description: Choreograph duo or small group work.

F06C79391EF44286BBDD3F79A6B1A5A4.description: Use design (e.g., costumes, sets, lighting, sound) and technology, where possible, in addition to dance elements and composition principles to enhance expression.

6DC459B12ECA43A78E8C050E2BAC1E99.description: Use tension and resolutions purposefully in dance.

F8C17FAA7BDC4EB7A8B08E386D77A361.description: Extend understanding of sequencing of dance phrases for expressive purposes.

7701DAD1FEDD44D78BA8DD67BE779F48.description: Use improvisation to explore and develop a dance idea.

81FE38C3498149B7BA6F98893A198416.description: Develop seamless transitions that sequence dance phrases in ways that exemplify the intended idea.

E9E825624BF14657BC3C0A00431F8C88.description: Investigate different ways of manipulating the element of relationships in individual and collaborative choreography.

EEF67188997947159B015F13E5F2CC67.description: Demonstrate expressive use of focus, individually, in pairs, and groups.

AA6BDAF4E5324CDE8973CBE2E6C16452.description: Investigate ways of using spatial designs, individually and with peers.

B775B357E295466AB04D187485F5AB80.description: Analyze, individually and with peers, how dance elements and principles of composition work together to express ideas in own dances.

330AB4BED82949408583F465ADC2C215.description: Investigate and use choreographic processes (e.g., individual and collaborative choreography).

C0DB38B3476D48338D986D65F7EF87EC.description: Collaborate on a youth-driven and teacher/communitysupported plan to raise awareness through the arts about a topic of concern to youth: Propose ways of including community members and artists who share the same concerns, and develop a collaborative action plan to share some parts of entire dances with others.

37AC629064684351BF7392A9E6DDA26A.description: Document the inquiry and creative process (e.g., journal entries, video, photography, blog, or digital diary).

BAD8609C01184729900A7CB940A96188.description: Reflect on how movement, dance elements, and principles of composition can be organized to convey meaning in dance (e.g., What message or main idea does our dance communicate about our topic of concern?).

CC5BE5F1534749648B0865B4174EBFB2.description: Investigate how a single idea can be developed in many ways and directions (e.g., How can we represent through movement the differing perspectives on this topic?).

E86493CD8B824A95A8A6ACE4B3DB2C24.description: Use inquiry in dance to express ideas about topics of importance to youth: Generate key questions to guide inquiry in dance (e.g., Why does the media often portray youth in a negative light? How could dance help to raise awareness or bring about change on a topic of concern? In what ways could we represent through dance the positive contributions of today’s youth to life in Saskatchewan?), Determine depth and breadth of personal knowledge to identify possible areas of inquiry, Generate additional relevant questions for exploration, Use the Internet and other sources (e.g., print, digital, community) to gather ideas for dance making, Use the dance-making process to explore the central inquiry questions and ideas (e.g., How can we show through movement the determination that youth must possess to improve the future?), Keep a record of dance phrases using invented and/or traditional notation symbols, and video where possible, to explore, record, and reconstruct movements. and Reflect, analyze, and make connections between the original topic or inquiry question and subsequent dance explorations.

88ABDDF158B6425E97A3F3661456CE83.description: Create dance compositions that express perspectives and raise awareness about a topic of concern to youth.

B8D2539127D74F5791663B332A363A5A.description: Creative/Productive (CP) - Children will inquire, create, and communicate through dance, drama, music, and visual art.
